page.title: 03Dedham - The Flood Plain
page.content: Dedham is on a sort of step made by flood waters which flood fields that are below the level of the step. The fields that get flooded are no good for growing corn and so on but are very good for grazing cattle because the water makes the ground rich so the grass grows well for the cows.Sometimes the river wears away the bank, changing the shape of the river.On the bank willows grow, they are pollarded willows. When the trees are young their branches are cut off and when the trees are older instead of having branches which hang down they have short spiky branches. They are lopped off after about ten or fifteen years and used for fencing.
